author: individuodigital1
title: Documental Vamos a cambiar el Mundo
description: 私たちは世界を変えようとしていますが、世界はそのことに気付いていません。コミュニティの仕事の大部分は 他人には見えないものです

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal attempts to address the existing GAP between the impact the Cardano ecosystem already has in people life and the general public's awareness of it. I believe it is brilliant that the team is seeking to increase this level of awareness by creating and distributing quality audiovisual material based on the experience of real Latin American cases, they plan to publish in traditional Spanish-speaking channels (TV and video distribution platforms). Although I see the execution of this documentary positively, if I evaluate it strictly under the objective of this challenge, unfortunately I do not see a direct link between the average user who can see the documentary in traditional media and the fact that this person becomes part of the community.
f6_assessments.q1: As far as the team's description of the skills and experience, I would like to commend their efforts. Referencing has been provided to verify the statements made. In addition, references should be provided for similar jobs that have previously been performed. I believe this is the most effective method for evaluating this aspect. The team does a good job of defining the budget by phases, which allows for a more accurate evaluation to determine whether the budget is appropriate or not. Despite this, I believe that they need to go a step further. As an example, phase one outlines the development of the idea, the creation of the website and social media, and phase three outlines tokenizing the audiovisual material and assigning them a value of $5000 each. As a good practice, I would suggest providing information regarding the cost of the hour per specialty and the estimated length of the contracting.
f6_assessments.q2: The team does a great job of separating the project into 6 phases, with a brief description of what would be happening in each phase. Unfortunately, the proposal fails to present information regarding the implementation times for each phase described. Due to this, it is difficult for the community to have transparency and auditability of the project. Regarding success metrics, the team defines two key elements: that the documentary is complete and that it is profitable for future projects. However, from my experience the first metric is more an implementation milestone than a success metric and the second one it is a success metric but it is very broad and depends on many external factors and is not necessarily directly aligned with this challenge.
f6_assessments.reply:
Impact/Alignment: 
Thank you for acknowledging the idea and the feedback in order to polish the proposal. Our hypothesis is that audiovisual products are the first hook for the knowledge of cryptocurrency projects and we believe that a product with a universal language such as film can generate much interest in the audience to participate in the Cardano network, this can be evidenced with the feedback we have in our podcasts and videos where we talk about the scope of the blockchain, and we see how many interested people arrive asking how they can build in the network and that already puts them as potential members of the community. The video itself can have the necessary placement type information to encourage participation in the initiatives.

Feasibility: 
Regarding the relative work done by the team, the following links are attached that show the audiovisual development, content creation, digital platform management, work within the Cardano network and connections with the real world:

- Cooking the Continent Documentary
https://www.amazon.com/Cooking-The-Continent/dp/B07BHXJKRW
https://3boxmedia.com/en/video/travel-lifestyle-series/cooking-continent
https://www.bergblick-tv.de/highlights-archiv/februar/cooking-the-continent.html

Regarding the detail of expenses by stage:

Stage 1: Launch of the Idea, creation of the website and RRSS.  (Designer, hosting, domains and community manager).
Value: $5,000 USD

Hosting and domain: $1,000.
Designer: $20 per hour (80 hours): $1,600.
Community Manager: $12 per hour (100 hours): $1,200.
Team: $1,200.-

Stage 2: Design and script writing. (Screenwriters fees)
Value: $3,000 USD

Scriptwriter: $30 per hour (80 hours): $2,400.-
Direction: $30 per hour (20 hours): $600.

Stage 3: Tokenization of the audiovisual project to promote community investment. (Contract developer fees)
Value: $5,000 USD

Programmer: $40 per hour (100 hours): $4,000.
Direction: $1,000.-

Stage 4: Pre-production, story selection and shooting planning. (Director, producer and support team fees)
Value: $7,000 USD

Director: $30 per hour (60 hours): $1,800.
Producer: $30 per hour (60 hours): $1,800.
Field producer: $30 per hour (60 hours): $ 1.800.- Field producer: $30 per hour (60 hours): $ 1,800.
Travel per diem: $1,600.-


Stage 4: Shooting of the Stories (Director's fees, producer, on-site audiovisual technical team, travel expenses and per diem. The audiovisual equipment (cameras, lights, stabilizers, sound recording and others will be provided by the audiovisual team).
Cost: $40,000 USD

Director: $30 per hour (200 hours): $6,000.
Producer: $30 per hour (200 hours): $6,000.
Field Producer: $30 per hour (150 hours): $4,500.-
Cameraman: $25 per hour (120 hours): $3,000.- : $3,000.
Live Sound: $20 per hour (100 hours): $2,000.
Contribution to the communities: $4,500.-
Travel per diem: $14,000.


Stage 5: Editing and post-production. (Fees for director, producer and video editors)
Value: $10,000 USD

Director: $30 per hour (100 hours): $3,000.
Producer: $30 per hour (20 hours): $600.
Editor: $25 per hour (200 hours): $5,000.
Designer: $20 per hour (70 hours): $1,400.- Designer: $20 per hour (70 hours): $1,400.- Designer: $20 per hour (70 hours): $1,400.

Stage 6: Issuance and Distribution.
Value: The amount determined by the tokenization contract is invested.
The tokenization process must contemplate tokenomics that can benefit the founding team, the communities that contributed to the development of the documentary, investors and the development of future documentaries or audiovisual products.


Auditability:
The timing of the proposed Roadmap is detailed:

Stage 1: Launch of the Idea, creation of the website and RRSS.
1Q 2021 (2 months)

Stage 2: Design and script writing.
1-2Q 2021 (2 months)

Stage 3: Tokenization of the audiovisual project to promote community investments.
3Q 2021 (2 months)

Stage 4: Pre-production, story selection and filming planning.
2-3Q 2021 (2 months)

Stage 4: Shooting of the stories.
3-4Q 2021 (4 months)

Stage 5: Editing and post-production.
1Q 2022 (3 months)

Stage 6: Broadcast and Distribution.
2Q 2022

To redefine the success metrics: 

First, it is reported that within the objectives of having the documentary as a completed product, Stage 6 is incorporated which determines the broadcast and distribution, being a good metric the amount of broadcasts that can be managed, defined in the number of broadcasts in media and the number of reproductions and reactions in VOD platforms or others.

The second success metric is redefined as the number of interested contacts that have been involved in any of the projects mentioned via placement in the video that demonstrate interest in participating in the Cardano network in any of its areas (pool operation, charities, software development, content creation, education and equity investment).

Conclusion: 
Being deeply familiar with the culture, idiosyncrasies and modus operandi of Latin America, thanks to the specific experience of our team, we believe that the film format can capture adoption in multiple areas of development the Cardano network requires and for this we seek to design a proposal that is objective technically and well-worked aesthetically and artistically.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is in line with the challenge, a documentary about how Cardano and blockchain technology in general is changing the world, would bring more visibility to the Latin American community.
f6_assessments.q1:
I see that both the team and the proposal are very well thought out, also the team seems to have experience in the development of documentaries, something that is not easy to develop (transmit, communicate, entertain, surprise and the rest of human feelings).

In addition, the plan presented is made in stages, very defined and clear, so I believe that the proposal will not have any problem to develop correctly, for this reason I give it 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the information provided by stages is very good, as well as your vision of success and what you want to achieve, however, I will give it 4 stars because I don't see KPIs to define the scope and impact of the proposal. It is not only about developing the documentary, but also measuring its impact on the community.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe that this proposal can make Cardano and blockchain technology known to the entire Spanish-speaking community.
f6_assessments.q1:
Both the proposal and the team are very well detailed, I see that they have experience in the development of this type of content, something very important, since they will try to connect sentimentally with the viewers, something that is quite different from the technical development.

I really liked how Individuo Digital explains things in their YouTube video talking about Cardano, so I think they can develop this proposal without the slightest problem.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap and development is very well detailed, which allows us to understand the evolution of the project.

The definition of success is also clear, the only reason I don't give 5 stars is because I consider that the KPIs are essential to measure the impact and success of a proposal already developed, something that we can't know without these indices.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal does not meet what the challenge seeks. The idea here is to produce a documentary series that explains what Cardano is and how it affects the world we live in, positively, of course. Which would be great to add value and spread the ideas / technologies of our ecosystem, but I don't see how this would benefit Latin American countries. The fact that audiovisual productions are mainly aimed at distribution in the Spanish language would make the project have more reach in Spanish-speaking countries throughout Latin America (in Brazil there would not be as much repercussion), but this would not benefit the countries themselves , its economy, people and so on. Therefore, I believe that this proposal, despite being a good idea, will not have the impact that we seek in the challenge; it would be better suited for an f6 challenge that aimed to encourage new people to join our community and also engage more of those who are already members (whether CAs, proponents, vCAs...), I don't remember the exact name of the challenge , but this proposal would be great if it had been launched there. Around here, I believe it needs to be revamped. One idea I thought was, it would be perfect if the entire team involved in recording the audiovisual content were Latin American! That way, we could generate income and engagement for the people involved here, and in this way benefit the local community that we seek to reach in the challenge. In addition to financial help, these people would learn about our technologies and perhaps participate in future rounds of Catalyst or invest in some way. But the way the proposal is currently launched, unfortunately I don't think it fits what was asked.
f6_assessments.q1: The team proves to be able to produce the documentary series with high quality. This can be concluded because at the bottom of the proposal they attached a video of approximately 4 minutes, which is very well done (I really liked it), and also on the youtube channel they present to us, which has a very high audience (higher at 10k subscribers!), much larger than most channels that are attached to proposals. The videos on this channel are also of high quality, with very professional photography, editing and sound capture. It is always beneficial when we know the names of those involved and their respective roles; it was of high value that the team also provided this data in the proposal. About a script, they define the creation of videos in stages. In my opinion, these phases could have been further broken down. For example, in step 4, "film the stories", where would they be filmed? What stories would be featured? It's not very clear if the team already has some pre-selected stories or if they would think about it after funding. I was also curious about the broadcasting and distribution part, although the authors clarify that the objective is to make the videos circulate on Spanish language channels, I would like to understand which ones, with which target audience, etc. I missed the team worrying about the dissemination of the content that would be generated, even though they have a distribution plan, it would be safer for us to clarify how they would advertise and engage people to watch the documentaries, especially those who they never had previous contact with Cardano. About the financial breakdown, they explain to us how the money would be divided, but this information could be more detailed. For example: in step 1, the costs would be allocated to: "designer, hosting, domains and community manager". But how would the $5000 USD be split between these parts? Because of these things, I think this part of the proposal is good, but there is room for improvement.
f6_assessments.q2: The team is concerned with drawing up a well-explained definition of success so that we can get a general sense of what to expect as a result of this project. It is also possible to exercise auditability through the monitoring of phases; as they define what would generally happen in each of them, we could choose a Spanish-speaking member to more closely monitor the progress of each step, bringing feedback to the community. I also think it would be a good idea for documentaries to be presented firsthand to community members; if the proposal were financed and became a reality, it would be amazing to schedule a live broadcast on youtube, or, depending on the duration, present it all/a piece during some town hall. So I think the auditability is good; all that remains is to establish a more solid bridge between the content that is produced and will be monitored with the Cardano community.
f6_assessments.reply:
Impact/Alignment: 
Thank you for acknowledging the idea and the feedback in order to polish the proposal. Our hypothesis is that audiovisual products are the first hook for the knowledge of cryptocurrency projects and we believe that a product with a universal language such as film can generate much interest in the audience to participate in the Cardano network and make it Grow in LatinAmerica, this can be evidenced with the feedback we have in our podcasts and videos where we talk about the scope of the blockchain, and we see how many interested people arrive asking how they can build in the network and that already puts them as potential members of the community. The video itself can have the necessary placement type information to encourage participation in the initiatives. 
This is the only advice we flaged intended that this is the best item evaluated by the other CAs, so we thing It can be reevaluated. Also, we offer a bit more details in below.

Stage 2: Design and script writing. (Screenwriters fees)
Value: $3,000 USD

Scriptwriter: $30 per hour (80 hours): $2,400.-
Direction: $30 per hour (20 hours): $600.

Stage 3: Tokenization of the audiovisual project to promote community investment. (Contract developer fees)
Value: $5,000 USD

Programmer: $40 per hour (100 hours): $4,000.
Direction: $1,000.-

Stage 4: Pre-production, story selection and shooting planning. (Director, producer and support team fees)
Value: $7,000 USD

Director: $30 per hour (60 hours): $1,800.
Producer: $30 per hour (60 hours): $1,800.
Field producer: $30 per hour (60 hours): $ 1.800.- Field producer: $30 per hour (60 hours): $ 1,800.
Travel per diem: $1,600.-


Stage 4: Shooting of the Stories (Director's fees, producer, on-site audiovisual technical team, travel expenses and per diem. The audiovisual equipment (cameras, lights, stabilizers, sound recording and others will be provided by the audiovisual team).
Cost: $40,000 USD

Director: $30 per hour (200 hours): $6,000.
Producer: $30 per hour (200 hours): $6,000.
Field Producer: $30 per hour (150 hours): $4,500.-
Cameraman: $25 per hour (120 hours): $3,000.- : $3,000.
Live Sound: $20 per hour (100 hours): $2,000.
Contribution to the communities: $4,500.-
Travel per diem: $14,000.


Stage 5: Editing and post-production. (Fees for director, producer and video editors)
Value: $10,000 USD

Director: $30 per hour (100 hours): $3,000.
Producer: $30 per hour (20 hours): $600.
Editor: $25 per hour (200 hours): $5,000.
Designer: $20 per hour (70 hours): $1,400.- Designer: $20 per hour (70 hours): $1,400.- Designer: $20 per hour (70 hours): $1,400.

Stage 6: Issuance and Distribution.
Value: The amount determined by the tokenization contract is invested.
The tokenization process must contemplate tokenomics that can benefit the founding team, the communities that contributed to the development of the documentary, investors and the development of future documentaries or audiovisual products.


Auditability:
The timing of the proposed Roadmap is detailed:

Stage 1: Launch of the Idea, creation of the website and RRSS.
1Q 2021 (2 months)

Stage 2: Design and script writing.
1-2Q 2021 (2 months)

Stage 3: Tokenization of the audiovisual project to promote community investments.
3Q 2021 (2 months)

Stage 4: Pre-production, story selection and filming planning.
2-3Q 2021 (2 months)

Stage 4: Shooting of the stories.
3-4Q 2021 (4 months)

Stage 5: Editing and post-production.
1Q 2022 (3 months)

Stage 6: Broadcast and Distribution.
2Q 2022

To redefine the success metrics: 

First, it is reported that within the objectives of having the documentary as a completed product, Stage 6 is incorporated which determines the broadcast and distribution, being a good metric the amount of broadcasts that can be managed, defined in the number of broadcasts in media and the number of reproductions and reactions in VOD platforms or others.

The second success metric is redefined as the number of interested contacts that have been involved in any of the projects mentioned via placement in the video that demonstrate interest in participating in the Cardano network in any of its areas (pool operation, charities, software development, content creation, education and equity investment).

Conclusion: 
Being deeply familiar with the culture, idiosyncrasies and modus operandi of Latin America, thanks to the specific experience of our team, we believe that the film format can capture adoption in multiple areas of development the Cardano network requires and for this we seek to design a proposal that is objective technically and well-worked aesthetically and artistically.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about producing a documentary film about the Cardano blockchain(its outcomes), connecting the stories of this community around the world. This is a great idea. The problem is clearly explained, and suitable to the given challenge. The solution is clearly defined, fit to the challenge, showing a clear impact on the ecosystem.
Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's impact, and  rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1:
Team profile is clearly described, with suitable skills, experiences, products for implementation of this film. The budget with items structure but no explanations of calculation base. There is a lack of risk and mitigation (filming documentaries may face a great deal of risk, natural conditions, pandemic, for example). 
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, and rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a lot of information provided (team profile, budget, roadmap) with some external links for verifying. However, the requested budget (>20% of total challenge fund) did not provide enough explanations of the calculation base for each item; and KPIs/ Metrics were not provided.
Therefore, based on the given information, I  disagree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 2
f6_assessments.reply:
Impact/Alignment: 
Thank you for acknowledging the idea and the feedback in order to polish the proposal. Our hypothesis is that audiovisual products are the first hook for the knowledge of cryptocurrency projects and we believe that a product with a universal language such as film can generate much interest in the audience to participate in the Cardano network, this can be evidenced with the feedback we have in our podcasts and videos where we talk about the scope of the blockchain, and we see how many interested people arrive asking how they can build in the network and that already puts them as potential members of the community. The video itself can have the necessary placement type information to encourage participation in the initiatives.

Feasibility: 
Regarding the relative work done by the team, the following links are attached that show the audiovisual development, content creation, digital platform management, work within the Cardano network and connections with the real world:

- Cooking the Continent Documentary

f6_assessments.q0: Developing a documentary on Cardano and blockchain technology could expand the growth and adoption of blockchain in the Latin American community. I believe that for this very reason, the proposal is in line with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has experience generating content, I have seen videos of Individuo Digital and as I am a Spanish speaker I can appreciate the study behind and the way they have to explain it, so I can appreciate the work it has taken, I see that the plan is also clear and there are several people together, so I think they can do it without problems.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan presents a roadmap and vision of success that allows us to know the deadlines and developments of the project, in addition to guide us in what would be the final product. However, I don't give it 5 stars because I consider that the KPIs are essential to measure the impact/success of the proposal: Viewers? Likes? number of communication channels?

solution: このブロックチェーンの歴史と現実世界での影響を語る、カルダノのドキュメントです。あなたのレッドの歴史を伝えます。
experience: このチームは、グローバルなドキュメント制作の経験があり、カルダノのコンテンツを恒常的に作成しています。
